newsitem.title: FRANCE: GAN falls hard on government dispute.
newsitem.headline: GAN falls hard on government dispute.

text.p: Shares in French insurer GAN fell 7.23 percent to a new year low at 109 francs shortly after the start of trading as investors reacted to uncertainty over the outcome of a battle between the company's chairman and the government.
At 0924 GMT, the share had risen from its lows and was trading 4.26 percent off at 112.5 francs.
On Monday the finance ministry called for the resignation of GAN chairman Jean-Jacques Bonnaud because he refused to support a government plan to privatise the company's banking unit CIC.
On Tuesday morning, Bonnaud said he would not resign, putting the government in the position of having to fire him.
"There are tensions between the company and its chief shareholder, the state, and that's never good for a company," one trader said of the share action.
Shares in CIC were a bit higher, up 0.31 percent at 322 francs.
